content.question: The figure shows a circuit comprised of a battery and six resistors with the indicated resistances. The labeled points indicate seven locations in the circuit, and the electric potential is defined to be zero at point <math alttext="O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>O</mi></math>. Which of the following pairs of graphs best represents the electric potential <math alttext="V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>V</mi></math> as a function of position along the two circuit paths <math alttext="A B C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ABC</mi></math> and <math alttext="X Y Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>XYZ</mi></math>? Assume that all graphs have the same scale for the potential.

choices.label: Two figures are shown. Each figure shows a line graph in a coordinate plane. In the first figure, the horizontal axis is labeled “Position,” is divided into six evenly-spaced units, and from left to right the values A, B, and C, are indicated at 0 units, 3 units, and 6 units respectively. In the second figure, the horizontal axis is labeled “Position,” is divided into six evenly-spaced units, and from left to right the values X, Y, and Z, are indicated at 0 units, 3 units, and 6 units respectively. Each vertical axis is labeled “V,” is divided into four evenly-spaced units, and the number 0 is indicated along it. The first figure is described as follows. The line graph begins at A comma 4 units, and moves horizontally to the right to 1 unit comma 4 units. It then slants downward and to the right to the point with coordinates 2 units comma 2 units. It then moves horizontally to the right, passes over B on the horizontal axis, and continues to the point with coordinates 4 units comma 2 units. It then slants downward and to the right to the point with coordinates 5 units comma 0 units. It then moves horizontally to the right to end at the point with coordinates C comma 0 units. The second figure is described as follows. The line graph begins at X comma 4 units, and moves horizontally to the right to 1 unit comma 4 units. It then slants downward and to the right to the point with coordinates 2 units comma 2 units. It then moves horizontally to the right, passes over Y on the horizontal axis, and continues to the point with coordinates 4 units comma 2 units. It then slants downward and to the right to the point with coordinates 5 units comma 0 units. It then moves horizontally to the right to end at the point with coordinates Z comma 0 units.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
